title: Two Junk And Trash Folders Displayed (GMail) after upgrading to Thunderbird 115
content:
After upgrading to Thunderbird 115, 2 spam folders (1 labelled Junk and the other Spam) and 2 Trash folders are displayed in my private GMail account.

In my Google Workspace account, 2 Trash folders (1 Bin and 1 Trash) are displayed.

Kindly advise how to fix.
creator: vivek_suraiya

title: Installing the new version of Thunderbird
content:
Hi, I have now Thunderbird 102.13.0 (64). When I install the new version it comes up with: AVAILABLE CONFIGURATION Incoming POP mail.bigpond.com Outgoing SMTP mail.bigpond.com

But I have at present: Incoming IMAP Mail Server Server name imap.telstra.com

Outgoing Server (SMTP) Telstra Mail - smtp.telstra.com (Default)

If I attempt to configure manually with my details It finds them wrong? Can you help? Regards Ilio Pieroni
creator: Iliopier

title: can't enter authorisation code to add FileLink Provider for Dropbox
content:
On downloading the FileLink Provider for Dropbox add-on this message appears:

Dropbox

Authorisation required!

1. Click this link to visit the Dropbox website and authorise this app. 2. Paste your code: 3. Save

The link takes me to https://www.dropbox.com/1/oauth2/authorize_submit where it says "Enter this code into Thunderbird CloudFile to finish the process" and a 43 character code is provided. However when I paste this code in the box and press Save Thunderbird says "Authorisation attempt unsuccessful".

Please help!
creator: k.fryde

title: Accessing email through Thunderbird
content: Installed Thunderbird on new pc (Win 10) and now find I need to sign in with my PW to send an email. This was not required with my much earlier version of TB
creator: deanwishart

title: Deleting entry and address book
content: I can't seem to delete an entry from the address book. I'm running Thunderbird 102.13 on an iMac, and when I right click on an entry the delete choice is grayed out. How do I get to delete the address?
creator: skipb48

title: Changing number of folders in Resent of Move to
content:
I have just upgraded to Thunderbird 115. I use the "Move to" menu item to move emails to different folders. When using the "Recent" menu item there are 21 folders listed. I would like to reduce the number of recent folders.

How can I change the number of folders listed in the "Recent" menu of the "Move to" menu?

Thanks Chris
creator: harrischrisa

title: need to extend default time to enter password to send the msg. times out before I can enter pw.
content: when writing a message the program wants a password send it out, send to draft on saves, etc. works fine for other times entering passwords. This does not happen each time I am sending the msg, just on certain occasions like a reply, automatic draft saves, etc. when requesting a password to sign in or other occasions it does not time out.
creator: swill

title: Thunderbird as offline .eml viewer ONLY.  How?
content:
Hi,

I just want to start Thunderbird offline and open existing messages as .eml files.

It seems to be impossible to create a mail folder view without a entering a mail account.

Why is this so difficult and what's the best way to hack Thunderbird into performing this seemingly trivial task?

I use Linux.

Ps: I've managed to start Thunderbird in offline mode, as per instructions here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1364783

There seems to be some way to do this by mungeing 'Local Folders' but seems to trigger infinite recursion and other bugs.. Ideally, for my use case, Thunderbird should not try to import the messages, simply allow me to view them. I want to use it as a viewer, not an agent.

Still experimenting. I'll update if I have a breakthru.


Cheers, Raro
creator: firefox.raro
